qas.question: What, when taken orally, can reduce total crying time of newsborns undergoing a painful procedure?
What doesn't sugar change the effect of pain on?
Sugar also doesn't measurably change what type of electrical activity in the brains of newborns a second after the heel lance procedure?
A sweet oral liquid does moderately reduce the incidence and duration of what?
What reduces the duration of the first cry in newborns undergoing painful procedures?
What reduces the duration of crying in children between one and twelve years of age?

plausible_answers.text: the effect of pain on heart rate

qas.question: What does sugar moderate the effect of pain on?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Sugar<a0_0/> taken orally<b4_0/> reduces the total crying time but not the duration of the first cry in newborns undergoing a painful procedure (a single lancing of the heel). It does not moderate <b6_0>the effect of pain on <a1_0>heart rate<b6_0/><a1_0/> and a recent single study found that sugar did not significantly affect <a2_0>pain-related<a2_0/> electrical activity in the brains of newborns one second after the heel lance procedure. <b5_0>Sweet oral liquid<b5_0/> moderately reduces the incidence and duration of <a3_0>crying<a3_0/> caused by immunization injection in children between one and twelve months of age.
